title: Adnan Siddiqui pays homage to Pakistani soldiers
text:
Actor Adnan Siddiqui has paid tribute to Pakistani soldiers with a musical rendition of Begum Noor Jahan’s song on Monday.

The 50-year-old actor took to Instagram to thank our soldiers for their services. “Aye rahe Haq ke shaheedon… this song by Noor Jahan Begum always brings tears to my eyes. The selfless service our soldiers do is beyond imagination,” he wrote. He thanked the soldiers on behalf of the entire country.

Related: Adnan Siddiqui pays tribute to his father

Talking about the importance of their job he said, “It’s a thankless job, I don’t know how many of us realise that we’re living in peace because of our soldiers guarding the nation day and night.”

Shahwar from Meray Paas Tum Ho dwelled on the sacrifices these soldiers make for our homeland. He went on to pay gratitude to the soldiers by playing Madam Noor Jahan’s song trough his flute.

He concluded by saluting every personnel and wrote, “Come hail, come storm they never step back from fulfilling their duties and keep our flag flying high.”

View this post on Instagram A post shared by Adnan Siddiqui (@adnansid1) on Dec 27, 2018 at 4:42am PST

More power to you Adnan! We totally admire you for being one of the most humble celebrities our country has ever produced.
